column11: 3-1. KAHOOT! is a game-based learning platform that brings engagement and fun to 1+ billion players every year at school, at work, and at home. Create your own quizzes (kahoots) in seconds, play anywhere, anytime, on your own or with friends, have fun and LEARN!
column12: 3-2. QUIZIZZ: Free gamified quizzes for every subject to play in class and at home. Pick an existing quiz or create your own for review, formative assessment, and more.
column13: 3-3. QUIZLET: Quizlet makes simple learning tools that let you study anything. Start learning today with flashcards, games and learning tools — all for free.
column14: 3-4. PLICKERS: Plickers lets you poll your class for free, without the need for student devices. Just give each student a card (a “paper clicker”), and use your Android smartphone or tablet to scan them to do instant checks-for-understanding, exit tickets, and impromptu polls.
column15: 3-5. BOOKWIDGETS: Create interactive exercises and automatically graded test, assign them to your students, and give constructive feedback. (GC integration).
column16: 3-6. METAVERSE: Create Magic In Your Classroom. Thousands of teachers and students are creating AR (Augmented Reality) in their classrooms. It is so easy to create that grade school kids can do it.
column17: 3-7. PADLET: From your hobby to your career, your class notes to your final exam, your mood board to your runway show, padlets help you organize your life. Padlet is a canvas to create beautiful projects that are easy to share and collaborate on. It works like a piece of paper.
column18: 4. The following technologies are NOT listed in the syllabus but are SOME examples of other topics that may be covered. Please indicate your interest in each. [Google Classroom]
